common_issues.title: Pieces Core Services Fails to Open Due to WebSocket Error
common_issues.description: Users across Windows and MacOS are unable to open Pieces Core Services.  A WebSocketException occurs with a 404 error when attempting to connect to 'http://127.0.0.1:39300/user/last_checked_in/stream#'. The PiecesOS version is unknown but expected within the 12.1.0-13.0.0 range.  Further investigation into the backend service and network connectivity is needed.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop update loop and Core Services 404 error
common_issues.description: Users on macOS and Windows are experiencing issues with Pieces Desktop. On macOS, the update process gets stuck in a loop, restarting the app repeatedly. On Windows, users are unable to open Pieces Core Services due to a WebSocketException with a 404 error when connecting to the local server.  Further investigation is needed to determine the root cause and potential solutions.

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop (MacOS) won't update
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop (MacOS) won't update
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

If I start Pieces Desktop, it tells me it's out of date.

When I click on "check for Desktop App updates" the loader loads to about 40% on the icon and then restarts the app and I get the exact same message.
So it seems your updater is stuck in a loop.

common_issues.title: Pieces Core Services Fails to Open Due to WebSocket Error
common_issues.description: Users across different operating systems (Windows, macOS) are unable to open Pieces Core Services.  A WebSocketException occurs with a 404 error when attempting to connect to 'http://127.0.0.1:39300/user/last_checked_in/stream#'. The PiecesOS version is unknown, but installations appear successful.  Further investigation into the backend service and local port configuration is needed.

Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Investigate the root cause of the WebSocketException with a 404 error when connecting to 'http://127.0.0.1:39300/user/last_checked_in/stream#'. This appears to be the most common issue affecting users on both Windows and MacOS.
Address the MacOS update loop issue where the Pieces Desktop app repeatedly restarts during the update process.
Verify PiecesOS installations and ensure the local port configuration is correct, especially concerning port 39300.
Provide support documentation or troubleshooting steps for users experiencing the "Unable to open Pieces Core Services" error.

Gather more information about the PiecesOS versions users are running when encountering the WebSocketException.  While the expected range is 12.1.0-13.0.0, confirming the actual versions will aid in debugging.
